enabled.description: Enable or disable the account feature

app.description: The Heroku app to add to.

addon_id.description: The ID of the existing Heroku Addon to attach.

app_id.description: The ID of the Heroku App to attach to.

name.description: A friendly name for the Heroku Addon Attachment.

acm.description: The flag representing Automated Certificate Management for the app.

buildpacks.description: Buildpack names or URLs for the application.

internal_routing.description: If true, the application will be routable

name.description: The name of the application. In Heroku, this is also the

organization.description: A block that can be specified once to define

region.description: The region that the app should be deployed in.

space.description: The name of a private space to create the app in.

stack.description: The application stack is what platform to run the application

app.description: The Heroku app to link to.

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable the App Feature. The default value is true.

name.description: The name of the App Feature to manage.

description.description: description of changes in this release

app.description: The Heroku app to add to.

private_key.description: The private key for a given certificate chain

app.description: The Heroku app to link to.

hostname.description: The hostname to serve requests from.

app.description: The Heroku app to link to.

url.description: The URL for Heroku to drain your logs to.

size.description: dyno size (Example: “standard-1X”). Capitalization does not matter.

app.description: The name of the app for this coupling.

pipeline.description: The ID of the pipeline to add this app to.

stage.description: The stage to couple this app to. Must be one of

full_properties.description: The file_url is only fetched during resource creation. To trigger another fetch the file_url should be changed, then a new resource will be forced on the next plan/apply.

file_url.description: or file_path must reference a file containing a slug archive of executable code and must follow the prescribed layout from Create slug archive in the Heroku Dev Center (nested within an ./app directory)

organization.description: The name of the organization which will own the space.

region.description: The region that the space should be created in.

shield.description: Whether or not the private space should be shielded.

rule.description: At least one rule block. Rules are documented below.

email.description: The email of the team member to set permissions for.

permissions.description: The permissions to grant the team member for the space. Currently create_apps is the only supported permission. If not provided the member will have no permissions to the space. Members with admin role will always have create_apps permissions, which cannot be removed.

name.description: The name of the VPN connection.

public_ip.description: The public IP address of the VPN endpoint on the network where the VPN connection will be established.

routable_cidrs.description: A list of IPv4 CIDR blocks used by the network where the VPN connection will be established.

space.description: The name of the Heroku Private Space where the VPN connection will be established.

app.description: The name of the team app that the team collaborator will be added to.

email.description: Email address of the team collaborator

permissions.description: List of permissions that will be granted to the team collaborator. The order in which

email.description: Email address of the team collaborator

role.description: The role to assign the team member. See the API docs for available options.

team.description: The name of the Heroku team that the team member will be added to.
